name: Fritillaria
description: Fritillaria is a genus of more than 100 species of herbaceous bulbous plants in the Liliaceae family, native to the northern hemisphere.Tall and wiry stem bears a circle of pendant, colorful and showy bell-shaped flowers. It is an eye-catching, elegant plant that reaches a height of 1,5 metres. Fritillaria is useful in beds, borders, containers, rock gardens and also as a cut flower.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Latin word “fritillus”, which means “dice box”, in reference to the checkered pattern on the petals of a number of species.
color_description: Fritillaria comes in variety of colors, from bright yellow to orange, green and deep red.
